aboutBody:
Imam Ath-Thahawi's Aqida (239–321 AH) is known as the Aqida of Ahl as-Sunnah wa al-Jamaah and represents the belief of the majority of Muslims for over 1,400 years. This text is presented so we can easily refer to and recall what we believe and how to live by it.

Full text is from Book 1 (Beliefs) of the Encyclopedia of Islamic Doctrine, Mawlana Shaykh Hisyam Kabbani. He reminds us: the historical weight of the statements in the Aqida is best understood when studied with the guidance of someone learned.

Unicode characters:
- ﷻ (Most Majestic, after the name of Allah)
- ﷺ (shallallahu alaihi wasallam, after the name of the Prophet)
- ؓ (radhiyallahu anhu, after the name of a companion)
